snippet: Emma O’Reilly, who worked for the United States Postal Service cycling team, said she transported doping material across borders and distributed performance-enhancing substances to the riders.
abstract: Emma O'Reilly, who worked as an assistant and masseuse for the United States Postal Service cycling team, admits in interview to carrying out several duties related to the team's extensive doping operation; her testimony is at the heart of the United Sates Anti-Doping Agency's formal case against Lance Armstrong.
lead_paragraph: Emma O’Reilly, who worked for the United States Postal Service cycling team, said she transported doping material across borders and distributed performance-enhancing substances to the riders.

headline.seo: Lance Armstrong’s Former Masseuse Tells of Doping
headline.main: Armstrong Aide Talks of Doping and Price Paid
headline.print_headline: Armstrong Aide Talks of Doping And Price Paid
